text: The APOE ε4 allele (rs429358) is strongly associated with increased risk of Alzheimer's disease in multiple populations.
CD33 variant rs3865444 affects microglial function and is linked to reduced Alzheimer's disease susceptibility.
TREM2 R47H mutation (rs75932628) increases Alzheimer's disease risk by impairing microglial response to neuronal damage.
BIN1 genetic variants show association with tau pathology in Alzheimer's disease, independent of amyloid-beta.
The minor allele of rs3865444 in CD33 reduces protein expression on immune cells and may protect against AD.
APOE ε4 carriers exhibit altered lipid metabolism and cholesterol homeostasis, contributing to amyloid accumulation.
Genome-wide association studies identified CLU (clusterin) as a significant risk locus for late-onset Alzheimer's disease.
PICALM variants influence endocytosis and synaptic vesicle recycling, affecting amyloid-beta clearance mechanisms.
The rs429358 variant in APOE shows the strongest genetic association with Alzheimer's disease across ethnic groups.
SORL1 gene variants affect APP processing and amyloid-beta production in neuronal cells.
CR1 complement receptor variants are associated with increased amyloid plaque deposition in brain tissue.
ABCA7 loss-of-function variants increase Alzheimer's disease risk through disrupted lipid transport.
MS4A gene cluster variants modulate immune response and show genome-wide significant association with AD.
GWAS meta-analysis revealed 19 genetic loci associated with Alzheimer's disease susceptibility and age of onset.
The rs75932628 TREM2 variant impairs recognition of lipidated proteins and microglial phagocytosis.
Functional studies demonstrate that APOE ε4 reduces synaptic plasticity and neuronal repair mechanisms.
Transcriptomic analysis shows CD33 expression correlates with microglial activation state in AD brain samples.
Network analysis identified BIN1 as a hub gene in tau-related pathways affecting neurodegeneration.
Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals cell-type-specific effects of TREM2 variants on microglial gene expression.
Mendelian randomization study supports causal role of CLU in amyloid-beta clearance from brain.
Proteomic profiling shows PICALM affects autophagy-lysosome pathway function in neurons.
Machine learning models predict Alzheimer's disease risk using polygenic risk scores from 50+ genetic variants.
Meta-analysis of rare variants in SORL1 confirms association with early-onset familial Alzheimer's disease.
Experimental validation demonstrates ABCA7 regulates phagocytosis of apoptotic neurons by microglia.
CRISPR-Cas9 knockout of APOE in iPSC-derived neurons reveals effects on cholesterol metabolism and synapse formation.
